bbc.title: Crown Princess's son arrested for alleged assault before rape trial in Norway
bbc.description: Marius Borg Høiby, who goes on trial on Tuesday, has been remanded in custody for four weeks after new allegations.

bbc.title: 'Enemy' insults and questioning Putin: Steve Rosenberg on tightrope of reporting from Russia
bbc.description: The BBC's Russia editor reflects on the difficulties of working as a British journalist in Moscow.

bbc.title: Israel reopens Gaza's key Rafah border crossing with Egypt
bbc.description: Only dozens of Palestinians and no goods will be able to cross in both directions each day.

bbc.title: Ukraine hails 'real results' after Musk restricts Russian Starlink use
bbc.description: Starlink-enabled drones have been linked to a number of recent deadly attacks by Russia on Ukraine.

bbc.title: Eighty kidnapped Nigerians return home after escape
bbc.description: They were among 177 people seized last month from three churches in northern Kaduna state.

bbc.title: Beijing criticises Dalai Lama Grammy win as 'manipulation'
bbc.description: The Buddhist spiritual leader is recognised in the audiobook category for his meditations.

bbc.title: Trump threatens to sue Trevor Noah over Epstein joke at Grammys
bbc.description: The US president labels Noah a "total loser" over a joke he told on stage during the awards ceremony.

bbc.title: Australian woman dies after becoming snagged in ski lift in Japan
bbc.description: The 22-year-old became caught in a chairlift and was suspended in midair before having a heart attack, officials say.

wsj.title: Palestinians Stream Back to Northern Gaza on Foot
wsj.description: Israel allowed displaced Gazans to begin crossing a military zone that bisects the enclave after a deadlock over hostage releases was broken.

wsj.title: Leading China Property Developer Reports Huge loss, in Sign of Widening Real-Estate Woes
wsj.description: Troubles at Vanke raise questions about the continued spread of the property crisis and whether the Chinese state will step in.

wsj.title: Freed Israeli Hostages Still Had Shrapnel in Their Bodies From Oct. 7 Attack
wsj.description: Some of the women were held alone for extended periods and spent eight months in tunnels, an Israeli medical official said.

wsj.title: Suspected Sabotage of Deep-Sea Cable Triggers First NATO-Led Response
wsj.description: The alliance mounted its first coordinated response to a suspected sabotage campaign against critical infrastructure after another cable was severed in the Baltic Sea.

wsj.title: Rwanda-Backed Rebels Enter Congo's Safe-Haven City
wsj.description: Residents of Goma reported gunfire and shelling after rebels overran Congolese troops. U.N. officials estimated that more than one million displaced people were now inside the city.

wsj.title: Cocaine-Funded Gangs Shake Colombia Years After Peace Pact
wsj.description: Attacks by powerful militias against civilians reflect the state’s inaction eight years after a peace accord removed a powerful rebel group from the field.

wsj.title: Italy Supports Saudi Arabia Joining Fighter-Jet Program, PM Meloni Says
wsj.description: The U.K., Italy and Japan have already partnered on the Global Combat Air Programme, which aims to put a new stealth fighter with supersonic capability in the skies by 2035.

wsj.title: Shippers Wary of Red Sea Routes Despite Houthi Pledge to End Targeting
wsj.description: The world’s top three container operators said they fear instability in Gaza and broader regional tensions mean continued danger.

wsj.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek
wsj.description: U.S. stocks were mostly lower, with the Nasdaq leading declines as makers of AI infrastructure suffered steep falls, many in the double digits. Nvidia was down 16%.

wsj.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
wsj.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.

wsj.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
wsj.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.

wsj.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
wsj.description: Gain insight on Experian, SoFi Technologies and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

wsj.title: Arabica Coffee Prices Hit Record on U.S., Colombia Tariff Spat
wsj.description: Arabica coffee prices hit a record level, as traders digested the withdrawal of President Trump’s threats to impose tariffs and economic sanctions on Colombia.

wsj.title: Swiss franc, Japanese yen Rise as DeepSeek News Boosts Safe Havens
wsj.description: The Yen and Swiss Franc were stronger against the dollar as investors sought safe havens after Chinese start-up DeepSeek’s new AI model hit U.S. tech stocks.

wsj.title: Natural Gas Falls on Shifting Weather Forecasts
wsj.description: U.S. natural gas futures fell after weekend updates took some of the chill out of early February weather forecasts.

wsj.title: Building-Products Distributor QXO Launches Hostile Bid for Beacon
wsj.description: QXO is taking its offer directly to shareholders after being rebuffed on several occasions.

bloomberg.title: Mexico Tries Diplomatic Talks to Maintain Cuba Oil Shipments
bloomberg.description: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum insisted her country will continue to pursue diplomatic channels to keep sending oil to Cuba on humanitarian grounds “without seeking confrontation,” after Donald T

bloomberg.title: India’s Rupee, Stocks to Get Tariff-Truce Boost, Investors Say
bloomberg.description: The US decision to sharply reduce tariffs on Indian goods should strengthen the rupee and boost Indian stocks, strategists and fund managers said.

bloomberg.title: Asian Stocks Climb With Metals as Volatility Eases: Markets Wrap
bloomberg.description: Asian stocks rose at the open on Tuesday, stabilizing after sharp swings in gold and silver sent ripples through markets, with the precious metals rebounding in early trading.

bloomberg.title: Gold Claws Back Some Ground After Dramatic Unwinding of Rally
bloomberg.description: Gold rose, clawing back some losses after the abrupt unwinding of a record-breaking rally that had driven prices down 13% in just two days. Silver also advanced.

bloomberg.title: Traders Pay Record to Hedge Korea as Chip-Fueled Run Unravels
bloomberg.description: Investors are paying more than ever to hedge against volatility in the South Korean stock market, which slumped the most since April on Monday after clocking in the world’s best start to the year.

bloomberg.title: China Sees Record Coal Plant Bids Even as Usage Declines, Report Finds
bloomberg.description: China fielded a record number of proposals for new coal-fired power plants last year — even as generation from fossil fuels fell amid a surge of clean energy.

bloomberg.title: Devon Agrees to Buy US Shale Rival Coterra for $21.4 Billion

bloomberg.title: Oil Steadies After Biggest Drop Since June With Focus on Iran
bloomberg.description: Oil steadied after dropping the most in six months in the previous session on easing geopolitical risks and a broader commodities selloff.

bloomberg.title: Latino Voter Shift Drives 31-Point Flip Against GOP in Texas District

aljazeera.title: What is the US strategic minerals stockpile?
aljazeera.description: President Trump said the stockpile would 'ensure that American businesses and workers are never harmed by any shortage'.

aljazeera.title: Relief for patients leaving Gaza as Rafah opens, but thousands still wait
aljazeera.description: Israeli restrictions mean only five Palestinians allowed to leave Gaza for treatment via Rafah crossing on first day.

aljazeera.title: France adopts 2026 budget after two no-confidence votes fail
aljazeera.description: New budget includes a $7.6m military spending increase and aims to cut the deficit to 5 percent by end of 2026.

aljazeera.description: Lawsuit argues US administration misuses claims of 'public charge', 'discriminating' against residents of 75 countries.

aljazeera.title: UN welcomes reopening of Gaza’s Rafah border with Egypt
aljazeera.description: Spokesperson Stephane Dujarric says the United Nations welcomes the reopening of Gaza’s Rafah border with Egypt.

aljazeera.description: Pakistan says it will boycott its T20 World Cup match against India on Feb 15 in Sri Lanka, risking a points forfeit.

aljazeera.title: Trump to slash US tariffs on India from 50 percent to 18 percent
aljazeera.description: Donald Trump had slapped India with a punitive 25% tariff for buying Russian oil on top of a 25% 'reciprocal' tariff.

aljazeera.description: Spain will provide a legal pathway for residency for migrants already living in the country.
